p: Figure 1 shows the weekly cases hospitalized in the six seasons. There was a predominance of influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 subtype in cases hospitalized in the 2010–2011 and 2013–2014 seasons, with hospitalizations reaching a peak in December, January and February. In seasons with a predominance of influenza B viruses (season 2012–13 and 2015–16), there was co-circulation with influenza A(H1N1) pdm09 subtype.
